message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper proposes a framework for learning distributed representations of attributes in text, which is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The use of word embeddings and the focus on language and document classification suggest that cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The use of machine learning techniques and the focus on learning representations suggest that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely categories. The use of meta-data and side information suggests that cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible category. Finally, the focus on authorship attribution suggests that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is another possible category.
